column4: can anyone here tell me how to pipe the output from locate --regex ".*\(ttf\)$" into cp output ./ ?
you want to output to file?
i want to copy all .ttf files to ./
then just | the previous command to cp
locate  --regex ".*\(ttf\)$"
then | cp ./
locate  --regex ".*\(ttf\)$" | cp ./
doesn't work
no nvm you would have to store them then cpo one at a time.
cp needs 2 params, orig location, and target
yes my bad.
so, I need to make a lil bash script then with the output from locate in an array
nah I think you can do it without a script
i'm just trying to remember how.
find / -name "*.mp3" -exec cp {} /path/to/flat/dir \;
well you want to find .ttf though
or you can use that syntax with your locate string
as long as its full path.
xargs is awesome
locate --regex ".*\(ttf\)$" | xargs -i -t -l1 cp {\} ./
